intro: Indofevillea khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, preferring well-drained soil. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, while its flowers are usually pale green or white with intricate patterns. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
